title: Wilfried Zaha is struggling to influence games for Crystal Palace this season - for the better of the team
text:
Wilfried Zaha wanted to leave Crystal Palace in the summer but without anyone willing to pay the money required to pry him from Roy Hodgson’s grip, he remained at Selhurst Park. By far and away Palace’s best player, an over-reliance on Zaha this season is beginning to show and may be to blame for his poor form.

Last season Hodgson used Zaha mostly on the left of a 4-5-1 or as part of a roaming strike partnership with Andros Townsend in a 4-4-2. From these starting positions he was able to dribble down the left wing and attack on his right foot when close to goal, isolated one v one with the opposition full-back.

By far and away Palace’s best player, Zaha's form has been poor this season and the team have only scored eight league goals - more than only Newcastle and Watford. The thing is, despite this Crystal Palace are enjoying an impressive start to the season - is he that important after all?

Rival managers target Zaha by doubling up on him, and defenders kick him a lot - Zaha is the second most fouled player in the Premier League this season and last - but this is old news and doesn't explain such a drop in performance.
